pageContext.claim: “If you look at children, I mean, they're able to throw it off very easily. It's an amazing thing. Because some flus, they don't. They get very sick, and they have problems with flus and they have problems with other things. But for whatever reason, the China virus, children handle it very well.”
pageContext.analysis: Children do not appear to get as sick from the coronavirus but they can transmit the disease to others. A large study conducted in South Korea using contact tracing found that children ages 10 to 19 can spread the virus at least as much as adults do; children younger than 10 were half as likely to transmit the virus, but there was still a risk. And in Israel, at least 1,335 students and 691 staff members contracted the coronavirus after Israel reopened its entire school system without restrictions on May 17, believing it had beaten the virus. The spike in infections among the children spread to the general population, according to epidemiological surveys by Israel’s Health Ministry.
